author: Paul Vieira
title: Bank of Canada: Most Firms Anticipate ‘No Clear Impact’ From U.S. Policy Changes
text:
OTTAWA—The majority of Canadian firms anticipate “no clear impact” on business activity over the next 12 months from the Trump administration’s policy changes on trade and taxes, a quarterly Bank of Canada survey said Monday.
The central bank’s survey indicated business confidence remains positive, bolstered by a “healthy” sales outlook due to robust U.S. demand. Firms signaled their intention to increase capital spending over the next year, and add to their payrolls. Some companies said labor shortages were among the biggest...
